intro: Henslowia crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf henslowia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Henslowia crassifolia is often found in dense vegetation, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native wetland ecosystems.
